result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua David Luce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count #1 court withholds sentence 5 years probation concurrent to 15CF90, but consecutive to 14CM415 (amended 7-11-16) -  conditions of probation costs $528.00  B Abenrath $2765.50  plus surcharges J&S with co-defendants, no contact with victims or co-defendants,   Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge. obtain HSED , obtain employment, DEF can no longer vote.  $1000.00 bond DOC to be applied to restitution
Consecutive to: 14cm415

miscConds.notes: 2765.50 plus surcharges   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$278.00 costs plus $250.00 DNA Surcharge   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Def. to get an HSED or GED.  Maintain Employment
no contact with victim or co-defendants

records.addlTxt: Request from DOC to correct restitution amounts in 15CF90 and 15CF91 (forwarded to Judge Winton's review queue. mak)

When this comes back from DOC please review the assessments because the DE was accidentally assessed restitution for the same three victims and amounts in both cases 15CF90 & 15CF91. The Amended Restitution Order will confirm which victims should be assessed into each case. The amended restitution order was uploaded to the DOC Interface and a seperate email was sent to DOC regarding this.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: From DOC regarding sentence credit

Defendant Joshua David Luce in court with attorney James McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received revocation packet and have no additions or corrections.
State argues for sentence: 10 yrs prison, 5 yrs in and 5 yrs extended supervision with rehabilitation services.  Atty McLaughlin argues for sentence to follow probation dept's recommendation: 4 yrs; 2 yrs in custody and 2 yrs extended supervision. 
DEF addresses court. Court addresses DEF.

Court: Orders 8 yrs: 4 yrs confinement and 4 yrs extended supervision. Concurrent to sentence in 15CF90.  DEF is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.   Convert from DOC Collect to Clerk of Courts Collect - any costs, fines or restitution still oweing.  DOC authorized to deduct from prison account for costs, fines or restitution, by a percentage of their discretion.
Remanded to Dodge Correctional unless Sheriff chooses to keep in Sawyer County due to pending case.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 12, 2018 at 12:00 pm.
OFF the record. Attorney James McLaughlin in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for January 12, 2018 at 12:00 pm.

Clerk contacted the Public Defender's office by phone.  It was verified that Jim McLaughlin was appointed in September, but court did not receive paperwork.  Public Defender's office emailed notice of hearing to Atty Jim McLaughlin about the telephone conference scheduled for Monday the 13th of November, since clerk could not send electronic notice to Atty McLaughlin.

Defendant Joshua David Luce in court, in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court has discussion with DE, who has been unable to get in contact with his attorney James McLaughlin.  Atty  Poquette states he spoke to Atty McLaughlin, just prior to this hearing, and he stated he could not appear in court.  Matter reset for scheduling.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for November 13, 2017 at 08:25 am.
